title: Dark matter: The matter we can't see - James Gillies

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: The universe is made up of a single element, a vibrating string.

options.text: The universe is made up of dark matter and dark energy.

options.label: C
options.text: A mysterious form of energy that drives the acceleration of the universe's expansion.

options.label: D
options.text: A single element, a vibrating string.

options.text: An invisible form of matter that makes up 68% of the universe.

options.label: C
options.text: A mysterious form of energy that drives the acceleration of the universe's expansion.

options.label: D
options.text: A single element, a vibrating string.

options.label: D
options.text: A theory that explains the acceleration of the universe's expansion.

title: Pool medical patents, save lives - Ellen 't Hoen

multiple-choice.question: What was the main challenge faced by the Wright brothers and other patent holders in the early 20th century?

options.label: A
options.text: They were unable to develop new aircraft designs.

options.label: B
options.text: They were forced to share their patents with competitors.

options.label: C
options.text: They fiercely defended their patents, hindering the development of the aviation industry.

options.label: D
options.text: They were unable to manufacture aircraft.

multiple-choice.question: Why were antiretroviral drugs unaffordable for many people in developing countries?

options.label: A
options.text: Because they were not patented.

options.label: B
options.text: Because they were too expensive to produce.

options.label: C
options.text: Because pharmaceutical companies held patents on the drugs and were unwilling to make them available.

options.label: D
options.text: Because they were not effective.

multiple-choice.question: What was the outcome of the medicines patent pool established in 2010?

options.label: A
options.text: It made antiretroviral drugs more expensive.

options.label: B
options.text: It allowed patent holders to license their patents to generic manufacturers, making the drugs more affordable.

options.label: C
options.text: It eliminated the need for pharmaceutical companies to license their patents.

options.label: D
options.text: It had no impact on the availability of antiretroviral drugs.

multiple-choice.question: What is the main difference between the airplane patent pool and the medicines patent pool?

options.label: A
options.text: The airplane patent pool was established voluntarily, while the medicines patent pool was forced by government.

options.label: B
options.text: The airplane patent pool was established by government, while the medicines patent pool was established voluntarily.

options.label: C
options.text: The airplane patent pool was used for military airplanes, while the medicines patent pool was used for antiretroviral drugs.

options.label: D
options.text: The airplane patent pool was used for commercial airplanes, while the medicines patent pool was used for military airplanes.

multiple-choice.question: What is the significance of the medicines patent pool has achieved in the past year?

options.label: A
options.text: It has made antiretroviral drugs more expensive.

options.label: B
options.text: It has allowed generic manufacturers to produce the drugs at a lower cost.

options.label: C
options.text: It has eliminated the need for pharmaceutical companies to license their patents.

options.label: D
options.text: It has had no impact on the availability of antiretroviral drugs.

multiple-choice.question: What is Nelson Obama's current situation regarding access to antiretroviral drugs?

options.label: A
options.text: He is still unable to access the drugs due to their high cost.

options.label: B
options.text: He has access to the drugs, but they are not effective.

options.label: C
options.text: He has access to the drugs, and his son will soon be 14 years old.

options.label: D
options.text: He has access to the drugs, but they are not available in his country.

multiple-choice.question: What is the main challenge facing the medicines patent pool in the future?

options.label: A
options.text: The lack of willingness of pharmaceutical companies to license their patents.

options.label: B
options.text: The high cost of producing antiretroviral drugs.

options.label: C
options.text: The limited availability of generic manufacturers.

options.label: D
options.text: The lack of government support.

multiple-choice.question: What is the significance of the medicines patent pool in addressing the HIV/AIDS epidemic?

options.label: A
options.text: It has made the epidemic worse.

options.label: B
options.text: It has had no impact on the epidemic.

options.label: C
options.text: It has allowed patent holders to license their patents to generic manufacturers, making the drugs more affordable.

options.label: D
options.text: It has eliminated the need for pharmaceutical companies to license their patents.

multiple-choice.question: What is the main difference between the current situation and the early 20th century?

options.label: A
options.text: The current situation is better, with more access to antiretroviral drugs.

options.label: B
options.text: The current situation is worse, with fewer access to antiretroviral drugs.

options.label: C
